section: Following the expiry of the Initial Term, the Supplier may amend the Territory to remove any Inactive Territories.
explanation: The term 'Inactive Territories' is defined in clause 1.1 as a country where the Distributor has not sold or supplied the Product during the Initial Term. Schedule 2 defines the Territory as 'USA'. Since the Territory is defined as only the USA and Inactive Territories is defined as country, it is impossible to have inactive territories as the territory is only one country, creating a contradiction.

section: The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$s within ninety (30) days of the date of invoice.
explanation: The phrase 'ninety (30) days' is inconsistent and creates ambiguity. It's unclear whether the payment deadline is 90 days or 30 days, leading to confusion on when payment is due.

section: Any notice required to be given under this agreement, shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by email, or sent by pre-paid first class post or recorded delivery or by commercial courier, to each party required to receive the notice at its address as set out at the beginning of this agreement or as otherwise specified by the relevant party by notice in writing to each other party. ... 20.3 A notice given under this agreement shall not be validly given if sent by e-mail.
explanation: Section 20.1 states that notices can be delivered by email. However, section 20.3 states that a notice is not valid if sent by email. This is a direct contradiction.
